main event: A woman, the wife of a UFO spotter, observed lights and sound of a UFO for 13 minutes before it left the area on February 6, 1963 in Chester, Pennsylvania.
interesting points: The object was silent and went straight up.
The object seemed to be stationary and was first seen in the north western sky and went into the north eastern sky.
The witness stated that the object was not an airplane or a meteorite.
A man reported seeing a very bright, disc-shaped object hovering about 100 yards from his home, making no noise whatsoever, on February 6, 1963 at 10:30 PM in Chester, Pennsylvania.

The man used binoculars and a telescope to confirm what he saw, and the object remained stationary for several minutes before suddenly taking off at a terrific speed, straight up and out of sight, still making no noise.
sighted object: a UFO, described as lights, sound, and a bright, disc-shaped object
witnesses: a woman, the wife of a UFO spotter, and a man
photographs: no, the report does not contain any photographs
